channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked road drain flooding road, 18th December
item.description:
Every time it rains the water pools over drain in road and does not drain away causing the road to flood

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crescent Drive, Petts Wood, Greater London

item.title: Renewed fly tipping between 30 - 36 Camberwell Road, SE5 0EN, 18th December
item.description:
I reported this problem a month or so ago and it was cleared - thank you. But it is now recurring. Originally there was one bin. After it was cleared there are now two. But neither are emptied. Please establish who is responsible for the dumping and the bins. And arrange for the bins to be emptied regularly, or removed if they are not to be emptied. If this is not remedied the problem will simply recur, with resulting health and fire hazards. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Road, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rosemont Avenue should not be a rubbish dump!, 18th December
item.description:
Rosemont Avenue is continually used as a rubbish dump. There's a large cardboard box near the junction with Woodberry Grove; a dumped on-board-sized suitcase further down Rosemont Avenue; white plastic wrapping has appeared further along. As well, there is assorted litter on the odd-number side of the road, accumulated leaves wet and slippery - very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Rosemont Avenue, North Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All 6 shutters graffitied at 56 Hemsworth St, 18th December
item.description:
Arrived at our office this morning to find graffiti on all 6 shutters, surely the perpetrators will be picked up by CCTV?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hoxton Square, Hackney, London

item.title: Noisy Drain Cover, 18th December
item.description:
Noisy broken drain or manhole cover. Clanging noise all day and night. Been over a year and no one has repaired it. Council know about it, Thames water know about it, no one taking responsibility.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain on the corner by the park, 18th December
item.description:
Drain blocked from leaves causing flooding in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nurserymans Road, Brunswick Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clean roads, muddy and slippery pavements., 18th December
item.description:
I wanted to highlight a slip hazard on a footpath and section of road in Argon road N18 and entrance of the former Orbital Business Park N18 3BW, where a major construction development is taking place to provide housing and retail units, as seen in the attachment we can see that the roads are regularly cleaned by a small truck.(company name and reg obscured as per the rules), These vehicles are being used to clean up the debris and rubble etc off the roads generated by the nearby development, however while the roads are clean the footpath/crossovers alongside this road particularly near the building site's entrance now have heavy build up of mud and grit, I have witnessed at least 2 people, almost falling to the pavement and road and I myself have also had a near miss this week with the slippery surfaces made worst by the current wet weather.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin on Merrow street, 18th December
item.description:
There is an abandoned wheelie bin on Merrow Street that is now overflowing with litter including food waste and old pillows. The bin has been left in the street for >2 weeks and not emptied. It is now apparently being used as a flytip with a black bag dumped next to it and waste overflowing from the bin into the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merrow Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human forest bikes, 18th December
item.description:
